original_title: 1,500 Sri Lankan Doctors migrated in one year
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); Sri Lanka's healthcare system faces a major crisis as over 1,500 specialists and doctors have left the country for overseas opportunities in the past year.
This mass exodus, driven by economic hardship and other factors, has resulted in the closure of at least 40 hospitals and threatens further strain on remaining medical facilities.
Dr. Chamil Wijesinghe, spokesperson for the Government Medical Officers' Association, paints a stark picture.
He warns that an additional 5,000 qualified doctors are poised to follow suit, potentially exacerbating the shortage.
He attributes this crisis to the ongoing economic downturn, which has severely eroded salaries and limited career opportunities for medical professionals.
